# Enable or Disable Categories

Account administrators can view the [notification categories](./#notification_types) along with their status on the **Notifications** > **Subscribers** page.&#x20;

By default, all notification categories are enabled. This means, recipients mapped to the categories will receive an email when a specific event occurs.&#x20;

Administrators can stop unwanted notifications by disabling a category. This will immediately stop the notifications for the recipients in that category until the category is enabled again.

{% hint style="info" %}
The Marketplace Platform doesn't allow disabling notification emails for profile updates, including password reset alerts and account invitation emails.
{% endhint %}

## Disabling a notification category

{% hint style="info" %}
The steps in this section are for account administrators who wish to manage categories at the account level. If you are not an administrator and want to manage notifications for your profile, follow the steps in [Manage Email Notifications](../../../marketplace-platform/getting-started/interface/manage-notification-preferences.md).
{% endhint %}

To disable a notification category:

1. Navigate to the **Notifications** page on the platform.
2. On the **Subscribers** tab, select the required category, for example, orders.
3. On the details page, select the arrow <img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="" data-size="line">in the upper right and choose **Disable**.
4. In the **Disable Category** dialog, add your comments in the **Notes** field. Then, select **Disable** to confirm the action. A confirmation message is displayed, and the notification emails are disabled.

<figure><img src="../../../.gitbook/assets/notifications_disable.png" alt=""><figcaption><p>Disable category dialog</p></figcaption></figure>

## Enabling a notification category

To re-enable a previously disabled notification category:

1. On the **Subscribers** tab in the **Notifications** page, select the category you want to re-enable.
2. Select the arrow <img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="" data-size="line">in the upper right and choose **Enable**.
3. In the **Enable** dialog, add your comments in the **Notes** field and then select **Enable**. A confirmation message is displayed, and all notification emails are immediately re-enabled.
